poem.title: Quince Jelly and a Packet of Crisps
poem.author: Peter McCarey
poem.text:
Quirks of Squatland Quiffs of fall, sheer Numbdom. Call it quits. Kilts and quilts and travelling rugs On troubling clits, it's Lazing on a sunny Afternoon to get my kicks in catnaps.
Stood there seeing our shoes Four canvas shoes at the London bus stop. The smaller toes turn in, the heels Lift as ae fond peck she puts To the puckered brow. Yesterday, on the internet, I found she'd married a Hotshot lawyer twenty-five Years ago.
